channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1952] Hollywood hellraiser Dennis Hopper dead at 74
item.description: Hollywood actor Dennis Hopper, best known for directing and starring in the 1969 cult classic "Easy Rider," died on Saturday at his home in Venice, California, from complications of prostate cancer.

item.title: [+1275] Glenn Beck Attacks President's Daughter
item.description: So, call me crazy, but I'm beginning to think that Fox News infotainer Glenn Beck's principles lack some internal moral consistency. See, a couple of days ago, Beck interviewed sometime-Alaska Governor Sarah Palin, and he took what appeared to be a principled stand on the matter of how people should treat the families of public figures.

item.title: [+1274] The Secret Powers of Time
item.description: Time is the most important resource you have. This video is a great example of how your perspective of time can change you.

item.title: [+1245] Dead dolphin covered with oil, sponsored by BP
[+1164] Speed Kills (PIC)
[+1152] On your marks... Ready.... NOOOO!!!!!
[+1093] Me...Want...Cookies...
[+962] What the f*ck is BP trying to hide?
item.description: When a photographer from The Times-Picayune earlier this week tried to hire a plane to fly over Grand Isle, the charter plane company was told that the flight could not descend below 3,000 feet. A BP contractor said media flights weren't allowed in the restricted air space established by the FAA. The restricted area is large, including huge...

item.title: [+940] Shhhh! Stay down....They didn't see you yet!
[+849] Why Isn't BP Under Criminal Investigation?
item.description: "BP is a convicted serial environmental criminal," West said. "So, where are the criminal investigators? The well head is a crime scene and yet the potential criminals are in charge of that crime scene. Have we learned nothing from this company's past behavior?"

item.title: [+769] Rachel Maddow: Gulf Oil Spill is History Sadly Repeated
item.description: Think the current oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico is an unprecedented disaster? Think again. Rachel Maddow uncovers an eerily and sadly similar oil disaster from 1979...in the Gulf...with even some of the same companies involved.

item.title: [+629] I Tore Mommy A New One! [pic]
item.description: Do not stare back at this little trailer park baby though. Do not stare.

item.title: [+608] The Trial of Pope Benedict XVI
item.description: The Pope can cite theology and tradition in defense of the church, but with many Catholics wanting a very modern kind of accounting for the sex abuse scandal, words and ritual may no longer be enough.

item.title: [+489] Men to be Locked in Same Room for 520 Days
item.description: Six men from Russia, Europe and China are preparing to spend 520 days together in a sealed-off warren to take a simulated trip to Mars to test how long isolation would affect humans.

item.title: [+451] Paramilitary Tactics Backfire for Detroit's Top Cop
item.description: Police chief Warren Evans was riding high. But then the death of a 7-year-old girl incited a backlash against his elite squads

item.title: [+436] How BPA Just Comes Up Short of Making Your Penis Fall Off
item.description: A new study from Kaiser Permanente finds that exposure to BPA -- which, as we're learning, is everywhere -- has a wide range of negative impacts on mens' sexual performance. The study found decreased sexual desire, more difficulty having an erection, lower ejaculation strength and lower level of overall satisfaction with sex life.

item.title: [+429] BP 'top kill' still not stopping flow
item.description: BP said Saturday that its latest bid to plug the worst oil spill in U.S. history still hadn't worked and experts suggested any progress was incremental at best.

item.title: [+426] 15 Things We Might See at WWDC 2010
item.description: After search giant Google hurled a barrage of not-so-subtle spears in Apple’s direction at the Google I/O developer conference, all eyes are now on the World Wide Developer Conference that Cupertino will be launching June 7 with a keynote from CEO Steve Jobs.

item.title: [+422] The 50 Worst Inventions (Gallery)
item.description: From the zany to the dangerous to the just plain dumb, here is TIME's list (in no particular order) of some of the world's bright ideas that just didn't work out.

item.title: [+411] The Art of Missing Pieces [PICS]
item.description: Bruno Catalano’s bronze sculptures have one thing in common: they’re drawing a blank, literally. Where there should have been a body, a shirt or an arm there’s, well, nothing.
